channel.title: Good Hoster?
channel.description:
Uh if anyone can [b]help[/b] me find a [b]awesome[/b] hoster. [b]Paid[/b] of course.
[b]Scripts allowed: [/b] ( <--- = Most Important ) PHP <--- Perl CGI ASP/ASP.NET <---- Cold Fusion v5 <--- Javascript/DHTML <----
[b]File Transfer:[/b] -[b]5000 + People[/b] [b]uploading [/b] documents onto 'our' website. Need that much [b]space[/b] of [b]transfering[/b] availible. -At least 100GB + Of [b]Disk space[/b]. -A few 5241 'computers' +, going onto the website. Need that much [b]traffic space[/b]. not all the time, just an [b]estimate of all the computers that are gonna be accessing the website[/b]. but count on at [b]least 300 - 700 computers at one time.[/b]
FTP Access [b]of course.[/b] FrontPage 2003/etc [b]extension.[/b]
And all of the [b]extra features[/b] that come with that [b]specific host.[/b] Paying up to 80 Dollars [b]a year[/b], [b]just 1 domain.[/b]
Yes [b]i tried [/b] google. I just want to [b]'hear' [/b] what a more experienced [b]'voice' [/b] says.
Thanks in[b] advance![/b]
Sorry if this is the wrong section, just seems correct, since its webpage design, kinda.

item.title: Good Hoster?
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

Paying up to 80 Dollars a year, just 1 domain.
? Not going to get all those features

Read full topic

item.title: Good Hoster?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Lol, talk to any entrepreneurs who have succeeded and they will tell you take your projection and kill it. Seriously nothing ever goes to plan. Besides of which you can’t just presume that the entire school will join up, because they just wont.

Not to kill your idea, it’s probably really good but now-a-days if it’s good it’s been taken or the week your projects gets popular some giant like Google will code a competitor withing a 10th of the time (brute forced man power) and rape your site.

Try hard; keep at it. Good luck but don’t be too expectant (480,000$ for a start up company means either your onto the next youtube or you’ve over projected).

Read full topic

yah mopar was lucky and be bribed some poeple with admin ship and then lots of poeple came here.

but yah start out even with a free hoster then shared then once you are making enuff moeny get dedicated servers.

item.title: Good Hoster?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:9, topic:142460”]Let me just say this. I’m skeptical you’ll get any money for the first few years, no matter how good the idea is. So many internet start-ups burn out by wasting money on anticipating visitors (thinking of a dedi and you haven’t even finished coding?), and they get nothing for the initial months/years.[/quote]Ofc, this forum was an instant success just because of the timing.

Read full topic

item.title: Good Hoster?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Java Is My Bitch™:

If you hear the idea you will think its a good idea. People are very big on saving money and recycling(hint hint). its not a recycling shit, just a good thing effect that comes out of it. College students will like it more. Trust me its a good idea. Never been done before, i searched google, and from my own personal i never seen anything like it, very original, but the name isn’t lol. Oh wells.

If you actually read my post, which I believe is good advice, you’ll read that it really doesn’t matter how good of an idea it is. Yoonew, for example, was created in 2003. Now they have thousands of users. But at its inception, it made almost no money. This holds true for almost all internet start-ups. I’m skeptical at the idea of renting a dedicated server for the 10 users you’ll have at its start.

Read full topic

item.title: Good Hoster?
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:9, topic:142460”]Let me just say this. I’m skeptical you’ll get any money for the first few years, no matter how good the idea is. So many internet start-ups burn out by wasting money on anticipating visitors (thinking of a dedi and you haven’t even finished coding?), and they get nothing for the initial months/years.

Get shared hosting, then when you finish the site, and it’s close to its bandwidth limit, then get a dedi server.[/quote]

The website isn’t going up this year. It’s going up my sophmore year.

If you hear the idea you will think its a good idea. People are very big on saving money and recycling(hint hint). its not a recycling shit, just a good thing effect that comes out of it. College students will like it more. Trust me its a good idea. Never been done before, i searched google, and from my own personal i never seen anything like it, very original, but the name isn’t lol. Oh wells.

[quote=“ThugLife, post:10, topic:142460”]*Notices the google ads at the bottom and top of page
Hmm maybe they will offer you some assistance?[/quote]

Want to get a proffessional opinion.

Read full topic

item.title: Good Hoster?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Let me just say this. I’m skeptical you’ll get any money for the first few years, no matter how good the idea is. So many internet start-ups burn out by wasting money on anticipating visitors (thinking of a dedi and you haven’t even finished coding?), and they get nothing for the initial months/years.

Get shared hosting, then when you finish the site, and it’s close to its bandwidth limit, then get a dedi server.

Read full topic

item.title: Good Hoster?
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:2, topic:142460”]1and1.com MS Home is all right.

I don’t know why you’d need PHP and ASP. Javascript isn’t supported by the server; it’s client-side.
If you only needed PHP, you could get the Linux version instead.
But whatever.[/quote]

Well mainly i need ASP, i just put PHP as a precaution if i might need it later, Because ASP is windows, so i need a windows server. Linux doesn’t have that.

I need ASP because i’m making a database, In my other thread about 'whats wrong with upload action code? well i’m going to use that to upload the file onto that database. and from the database the person viewing will be able to open the file and see what’s in it.

[quote=“Mopman, post:3, topic:142460”][quote author=Java Is My Bitch link=topic=194904.msg1750714#msg1750714 date=1189577858]
but count on at least 300 - 700 computers at one time.
[/quote]

Shared hosting aint gonna cut it, you need a dedi (if not two).

What site is this for, may I ask?[/quote]

I can’t reveal that, like i want to. But i think its a very good idea, and i don’t want it to be stolen. Not that i don’t trust you, but someone reading the post…

Ah ok, i’ll go for a dedicated. Any in mind that can carry that much traffic?

Just a projection but, i’m starting it in my school, I ‘project’ to make $480,000 in 10 months or 11 months. Though it will vary alot depending on the people. And its only that amount because there are 5300 something people at my school. Theres alot of things to do though, verify it by the principal, and the money won’t go to me, well some of it :P. Paying students to do some of the work, etc. Proffessionals ask too much $, why not get students who will do it for 1/4 of the price?

[quote=“Pwnd, post:7, topic:142460”][quote author=xxlegitxx link=topic=194904.msg1750884#msg1750884 date=1189581897]

Shared hosting aint gonna cut it, you need a dedi (if not two).

What site is this for, may I ask?

$80 a year? I doubt you could get good dedicated servers for that.
[/quote]More like 80$ a month, haha.[br][size=1]Posted on: September 12, 2007, 10:34:01 AM[/size][hr][quote author=Cyclone link=topic=194904.msg1751482#msg1751482 date=1189628272]
www.ulmb.com awesum hoster… free and payed domains availible good
[/quote]You obviously haven’t looked at his requirements.[/quote]

Well if the business starts out “Ok”, i will reel in, 300 bucks at least. Per month.

Read full topic

item.title: Good Hoster?
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Uh if anyone can help me find a awesome hoster. Paid of course.

Scripts allowed: ( <— = Most Important )
PHP <—
Perl
CGI
ASP/ASP.NET <----
Cold Fusion v5 <—
Javascript/DHTML <----

File Transfer:
-5000 + People uploading documents onto ‘our’ website. Need that much space of transfering availible.
-At least 100GB + Of Disk space.
-A few 5241 ‘computers’ +, going onto the website. Need that much traffic space. not all the time, just an estimate of all the computers that are gonna be accessing the website. but count on at least 300 - 700 computers at one time.

FTP Access of course.
FrontPage 2003/etc extension.

And all of the extra features that come with that specific host.
Paying up to 80 Dollars a year, just 1 domain.

Yes i tried google. I just want to ‘hear’ what a more experienced ‘voice’ says.

Thanks in advance!

Sorry if this is the wrong section, just seems correct, since its webpage design, kinda.

Read full topic
